page.title: 06FARMING - OTHER ACTIVITIES
page.content: There are five farms that send milk to Express Dairys at Appleby. A milk tanker comes round every day to collect the milk from the bulk storage tanks at each farm. There are ten farms that rear beef cattle and bullocks. There are many kinds including Charolais,Limousin and Hereford. The local auction marts are at Kendal,Penrith, Appleby,Kirkby Stephen and Sedburgh. There are 11 sheep farms which keep Rough fell, Cheviot, Swaledale, Suffolk and Teeswater flocks. In June and July the farmers get their silage and hay. To make hay they cut the grass with a mowing machine, straw it out to dry, row it up, bale it, stook it and lead it in with a bale slave. The bales are stored in barns until needed for winter fodder.
